required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose Escalation Study to Investigate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of GSK2849330 in Subjects With Advanced Her3-Positive Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, First Time in Human, Open-Label, Dose Escalation Study to Investigate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Anti-Her3 Monoclonal Antibody GSK2849330 in Subjects With Advanced Her3-Positive Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 3 (HER3) expression is seen across a wide variety of solid malignancies and is associated with poor prognosis. Up-regulation of HER3 expression and activity is also associated with resistance to multiple pathway inhibitors. GSK2849330, a monoclonal antibody targeting HER3, is a new agent for subjects whose tumors express HER3. This study is a phase I, first time in human, open-label, dose escalation study. The purpose of this study is to investigate the safety, pharmacokinetics (PK), and pharmacodynamics (PD) of GSK2849330 in subjects with advanced HER3-positive solid tumors. The study will be conducted in two parts. Part 1 (Dose-Escalation Phase) will include dose escalation and PK/PD cohorts to evaluate safety, PK, and PD to guide selection of dose regimen(s) for Part 2. In Part 2 (Expansion Cohorts), up to 3 cohorts will be enrolled at the dose regimen(s) selected based on Part 1 data, to evaluate safety in a larger cohort of subjects at the recommended dose regimen and also to evaluate preliminary evidence of clinical benefit.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1 and Part 2: From Day 1 up to 45 days or 5 half lives (whichever is longer) after last dose of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: SAEs assessed as related to study participation , study treatment or GSK concomitant medication must be recorded from the time a subject consents to participate in the study up to and including any follow-up contact

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1 and Part 2: From Day 1 up to Day 29
primary_outcome.description: An event will be considered a DLT if it occurs within the first 4 weeks (28 days) of treatment, and meets one of the protocol defined criteria unless it can be clearly established that the event is unrelated to treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1 and Part 2: From Screening up to approximately 28 days after the last dose of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Laboratory tests will include hematology, clinical chemistry and urinalysis parameters

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1 and Part 2: From Screening up to approximately 28 days after the last dose of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Single 12-lead ECGs will be obtained at scheduled time points

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1 and Part 2: From Screening up to approximately 28 days after the last dose of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Vital sign measurements will include systolic and diastolic blood pressure and pulse rate

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1 and Part 2: Scheduled timepoints from Day 1 until 45 days or 5 half lives (whichever is longer) after last dose of study treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Total and phospho-HER3 from tumor tissue
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1 and Part 2: Screening (pre-treatment) and either Day 15 or Day 22 depending on dosing schedule
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor biopsies will be obtained and analyzed for total and phospho-HER3

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibodies to GSK2849330 assessed in serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1 and Part 2: Scheduled timepoints from Day 1 until 45 days or 5 half lives (whichever is longer) after last dose of study treatment
Part 2: Screening and Every 8 or 9 weeks from the first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Response evaluations (either complete response [CR] or partial response [PR]) will be determined according to the definitions established in the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST 1.1)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part 2: Day 1 and Every 8 or 9 weeks from the first dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor markers will be collected as applicable to the subject's primary tumor type

arm_group.description: 1 hour infusion administered intravenously at intervals of one week or more (escalating doses).
Intravenous infusion administered at the dose and schedule established in Part 1

intervention.description: Solution containing 100 mg/millilter (mL) GSK2849330 for intravenous infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females >=18 years of age (at the time consent is obtained).
- Written informed consent provided.
- Performance Status score of 0 or 1 according to the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) scale.
- Sufficient archival tumor specimen is available for HER3 immunohistochemistry (IHC) analysis, or subject is willing to undergo a fresh tumor biopsy for HER3 IHC analysis.
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of one of the following solid tumor malignancies for which no standard therapeutic alternatives exist: bladder cancer, breast cancer, castrate-resistant prostate cancer, cervical cancer, colorectal cancer (CRC), gastric cancer, hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), melanoma, non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), ovarian cancer, pancreatic cancer, squamous cancers of the head and neck region (including parotid and nasopharynx).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with leptomeningeal or brain metastases or spinal cord compression.
- Prior HER3- directed treatment (HER2- or EGFR-directed treatment is acceptable).
- Concurrent medical condition that would jeopardize compliance.
- Receiving chronic immunosuppressive therapies (includes daily steroid doses in excess of 20 milligrams [mg]/day of prednisone).
